secondLevel.text: Responding to Contentious Issues As a Catholic Educator

thirdLevel.text: Q. If the Church is holy, why do sinful things happen?

fourthLevel.text: R: At the same time as it is holy and spiritually perfect, the Church is also earthly and humanly imperfect.

thirdLevel.text: Q. If there is human error in the Church, how do I know what it teaches about Christ is true?

fourthLevel.text: R. We need to understand how the Holy Spirit guides the Church, the difference between legitimate authority and illegitimate authority, and how illegitimate authority leads to abuse and scandal.

thirdLevel.text: Q. The word scandal is used in the Church to identify actions that cause others to sin or negatively affect people’s relationship with God. How has the sexual abuse of minors in the Church and its cover-up caused this type of scandal?

fourthLevel.text: R. It has put an obstacle to Christ and faith in many people’s path. It has harmed many victims. It has caused countless others to reject Christ, the Church, and even God because of the misuse of authority.

thirdLevel.text:
Q. Is there a way to heal from this crisis and from other
 crises in the Church? How do we move forward? How do
 we trust again?

fourthLevel.text:
R. The institutional Church and the individual members of
 its faith community—even those who have done nothing wrong themselves—must both acknowledge the harm caused by scandal and react to it in specific ways that can begin the healing process. Both must also be proactive in preventing future abuse and scandal.
What Are Its Signs and Symbols?
What Are Its Signs and Symbols?
